newsitem.title: CROATIA: Unilever sets up Croatian subsidiary.
newsitem.headline: Unilever sets up Croatian subsidiary.

text.p: Cosmetics-to-detergents firm Unilever said on Tuesday it had established a full subsidiary to take care of its operations in Croatia.

"One of the company's goals is to explore the possibilities of further investment in Croatia," country manager Marcel Kerkmeester said in an invitation to the official opening ceremony, set for May 6.

Unilever said in the past it planned to secure a leading market position in a tough environment, dominated by strong local competition of cosmetics and hygienic products by Pliva and Saponia companies.
Over the past five years Unilever was present on the Croatian market through a representative firm. It is one of the first multinationals to open their own subsidiaries here.

Its presence has been felt strongly through advertisements for products including Omo detergent and anti-perspirants on state television and other media in recent months. -- Kolumbina Bencevic, Zagreb Newsroom, 385-1-4557075
